intro: Characias amygdaloides, commonly known as the almondleaf plant, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are lanceolate and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
